body:
I have updated the issue after testing it under Windows 10. it gives the same error.
I also added a step to reproduce in order to create a (possible empty) playbook file.

issue.title: Cannot run arch-vagrant with Vagrant 2.2.5

labels.name: vagrant
labels.description: The issues is specific to arch-vagrant

repository.name: arch-ansible
repository.description: An Ansible playbook to install Arch Linux

issue.body:
Vagrant 2.2.5 breaks arch-ansible. It fails to auto-install Ansible on the target machine for use by the `ansible_local` provisioner.

There is a open issue on their tracker: https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/issues/11048

For the moment I simply downgraded my Vagrant installation to 2.2.4. If this takes too much time to fix I might consider moving the installation to some script.

body:
I see this as well..

```
==> default: Running provisioner: ansible_local...
    default: Installing Ansible...
==> default: Forcing shutdown of VM...
==> default: Destroying VM and associated drives...
/opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/plugins/provisioners/ansible/cap/guest/arch/ansible_install.rb:10:in `ansible_install': wrong number of arguments (given 5, expected 4) (ArgumentError)
        from /opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/lib/vagrant/capability_host.rb:111:in `call'
...
```

Same situation on:

Archlinux: `5.3.7-arch1-1-ARCH`
Vagrant: `2.2.6`
Ruby: `ruby 2.6.5p114 (2019-10-01 revision 67812) [x86_64-linux]`

Image: `archlinux/archlinux (virtualbox, 2019.04.05)`
Image: `archlinux/archlinux (virtualbox, 2019.10.02)`

```
/opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/gems/vagrant-2.2.6/plugins/provisioners/ansible/cap/guest/arch/ansible_install.rb:10:in 'ansible_install': wrong number of arguments (given 5, expected 4) (ArgumentError)
```

issue.title: FIX #11048, ansible_local provisioner, fails to install Ansible on an Arch Linux box

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
FIX #11048, add parameter `pip_install_cmd` to `ansible_install.rb` for arch guest.

ADD: Handling of `pip_install_cmd` in `ansible_install.rb` for arch guest.

rename.from: ansible_local provisioner in Vagrant 2.2.5 fails to install Ansible on an Arch Linux box
rename.to: ansible_local provisioner in Vagrant 2.2.5 fails to install Ansible on an Arch, SuSE and FreeBSD guests

body:
Renaming the issue, as the same bug (introduced by #10625) affects `freebsd` and `suse` guests.

See #11227 for upcoming bug fixes...

issue.title: ansible_local: Add `cap` bug fixes and related RSpec coverage

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
## Includes

**Bug Fixes:**
- [x] Review of #11148 (ArchLinux bug fix)
- [x] Fix method signature for FreeBSD and SuSE 

**Improvements:**
- [x] Trim the generated 'pip install' command in Ansible::Cap::Guest::Pip::pip_install

**RSpec Coverage:**
- [x] ArchLinux Guest
- [x] Debian Guest
- [x] Ubuntu Guest
- [x] FreeBSD Guest
- [x] SuSE Guest
- [ ]  Fedora Guest (will be implemented in a distinct PR)
- [ ]  RedHat/CentOS Guest (will be implemented in a distinct PR)

**Integration Tests:**
- [x] `archlinux/archlinux` -> caught  909cc20007bae1ead613c5f2c98c1508ba065a19
- [ ] `freebsd/FreeBSD-12.1-RELEASE` (will very likely be tested by @briancain for #11061/#11263)
- [ ] SuSE 

## References

- GH-6633
- GH-11048
- GH-11263

body:
I'm going to lock this issue because it has been closed for _30 days_ . This helps our maintainers find and focus on the active issues.

If you have found a problem that seems similar to this, please open a new issue and complete the issue template so we can capture all the details necessary to investigate further.
